com.sales.app

Class ShoppingApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sales.app.ShoppingApplication

  • public class ShoppingApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    The ShoppingApplication class is main class which is used to execute the application. This class is responsible for getting the input file location, iterating through each file and generating receipt
    Since:
    2019-Aug-04
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Abhishek

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getFilePathFromProperties()
      This method is used to find the input file location based on the application.properties file, we will use this location to iterate all the files available in that location
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void processInputFileDirectory(java.lang.String inputFileDirectory)
      This method is used to process the files, the inputFileDirectory will contain all the files and for each file we wll invoke processReceiptsForTax
      void processReceiptsForTax(java.io.File receiptFile)
      This method takes individual files and processes line by line, building product by calling builder.buildProduct processReceiptsForTax

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws InvalidInputException
        Throws:

      • getFilePathFromProperties

        public java.lang.String getFilePathFromProperties()
        This method is used to find the input file location based on the application.properties file, we will use this location to iterate all the files available in that location
        Returns:
        This returns File Path.

      • processInputFileDirectory

        public void processInputFileDirectory(java.lang.String inputFileDirectory)
                               throws InvalidInputException
        This method is used to process the files, the inputFileDirectory will contain all the files and for each file we wll invoke processReceiptsForTax
        Parameters:
        inputFileDirectory - This parameter denotes the directory where input reciept file are kept.
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - If the inputFileDirectory is not valid

      • processReceiptsForTax

        public void processReceiptsForTax(java.io.File receiptFile)
                           throws InvalidQuantityException,
                                  InvalidAmountException,
                                  InvalidInputException
        This method takes individual files and processes line by line, building product by calling builder.buildProduct processReceiptsForTax
        Parameters:
        receiptFile - This parameter is the single input file.
        Throws:
        InvalidQuantityException - If the quantity is less than zero
        InvalidAmountException - If the basePrice is less than zero
        InvalidInputException - If the receiptFile is not valid
